709367f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, north from W. 16th Street, showing the vicinity that was for a period the shopping centre. Under construction
underground is the new municipal subway.
The "El" structure at this date is being demolished. The atation of same is at 18th Street where Siegel-Cooper and B. Altman held sway.on opposite sides of this thoroughfare. The latter occupied he structure on the west side from 18th to 19th Streets. This builoing eppears at the left center of View No. 2, being photogaphed from 17th Street. An article on this subject appeared in the New York Times of March 7, 1939 titled "122 Year
Holding is Sold on Sixth Avenue.
February 19, 1939
Views: 1-2
P. L. Sperr

709364f-b.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, from W. 16th to 17th Streets. A parking lot occupies the northerly half of this frontage: this being the S. E. corner of 17th Street. The two buildings remaining are at the N. E. corner of 16th Street. View 3 being of an earlier date shows four buildings there. Two of these were subsequently demolished. The towering loft structures are on the side streets, backing dp
to each other through the block.
Views 1,2: May 17, 1939
View 3: April 3, 1935
P. L. Sperr
